original_title: Lanka Realty Investments land deal gives CSE a measure of revival
original_body_lines: The CSE was somewhat revived yesterday when leading residential, commercial and leisure entity Lanka Realty Investments divested Rs 1.1 billion worth of property belonging to the company to Prime Lands to focus onits core business activities. This deal improved the investment sentiment for other sectors as well, market analysts said.

The All Share Price Index went up by 70.38 points, while S and P SL20 went down by 7.42 points. Turnover stood at Rs 5.39 billion with five crossings. Those crossings were reported in Sunshine Holdings, which crossed five million shares to the tune of Rs 137 million; its shares traded at Rs 27.70, Central Finance 308,000 shares crossed for Rs 87.6 million; its shares traded at Rs 284.50, Access Engineering 1.3 million shares crossed for Rs 80.6 million; its shares sold at Rs 60, RIL Properties two million shares crossed for Rs 56.6 million; its shares traded at Rs 28.30 and Ceylon Guardian Investments 170,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 34.6 million; its shares sold at Rs 203.

In the retail market top six companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; RIL Properties Rs 291 million (9.7 million shares traded), Access Engineering Rs 261 million (4.2 million shares traded), Singer Sri Lanka Rs 197 million (3.3 million shares traded), Prime Lanka Residencies Rs 191 million (10.8 million shares traded), Lanka Realty Investments Rs 178 million (6.7 million shares traded) and Cooperative Investments Rs 165 million (38.30 million shares traded). During the day 216 million share volumes changed hands in 39000 transactions.

It is said that the real estate sector was active in the market, especially RIL Properties and Prime Lands. Further, the construction sector also improved, especially Access Engineering. Banking and Financial sectors were also active in the market.

Yesterday the rupee opened at Rs 301.60/80 to the US dollar in the spot market, relatively flat from Rs 301.65/85 Friday, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said. A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 8.98/9.03 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.50/55, up from 9.48/53 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted at 10.00/20 percent.
